markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Phalanx Piercer](/Weapons.aspx?ID=337)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concussive" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=401" />
<trait label="Hobgoblin" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=268" />
<trait label="Propulsive" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=191" />
<trait label="Razing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=488" />
<trait label="Volley 30 ft." url="/Traits.aspx?ID=201" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 31 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 10 gp

**Damage** 1d10 P

**Bulk** 2
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1+

**Range** 80 ft.

**Reload** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Category** Advanced

**Group** [Bow](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=3)
</row>

**Ammunition** [Bolts (Phalanx Piercer)](/Weapons.aspx?ID=351)

</column>

---

This massive bow is made from bone or wood reinforced with flexible metal strips and strung with reinforced cord. Designed by [hobgoblin](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=13) engineers to take down shielded opponents, the phalanx piercer fires heavy, iron-shod bolts.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-3" />
name: Phalanx Piercer
